ngiemboon: Pi júʼu nò gie mé faʼa légɔɔn. Nyìŋ gẅie mé la lɔg shúm ńtÿɔ́gɔ yé, á ńnyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ múɔ, à lɔɔn ńdáʼ ńnyé te gwɔ́ ndÿò, mbà à gwɔ̌ pɔ́ páʼ nkwɔɔn la, tà mbɔɔ páʼ shúm sie mé la nyé, é gwɔ́ pɔ́ sé.
en: Now I say that as long as the heir   is a child, he differs in no way from a slave, though he is the owner  # 4:1 Col 3:22 of everything.

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńnyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ múɔ mémúɔ, mbà à gẅiin léjúʼ ncwò pʉ̀a pie é tóonte yé mbɔɔ we pʉ̀a pie é líe shúm sé, tà láʼ kú ngùʼ gie tá we la záb.
en: Instead, he is under guardians and trustees until the time set by his father.

ngiemboon: Á gíŋ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ á laa fʉ̀ʼ gie pege la nyé ńgwɔ́ páʼ púɔ penkʉ́ la, pege gwɔ́ menkwɔɔn ńtí légiŋ gẅie mé giŋe mǒ tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn njÿó.
en: In the same way we also, when we were children, were in slavery under the elements   of the world.  # 4:3 Rm 7:6; 2Pt 2:20

ngiemboon: Táʼ, afʉ̀ʼ gie Ssé la záb la gwɔ́ tà ńkuʼ, á túmo Míŋ we. Á gwaa tó manzwě zye yé. Á ne ńnéŋe na páʼ lepʉ̌ Mǒonsê ne ńzɛ́te.
en: When the time came to completion, God sent his Son,   born of a woman,  # 4:4 Gn 3:15; Lk 2:7; Php 2:7 born under the law,

ngiemboon: À la tó púʼu, lécuʼ pʉ̀a pie lepʉ̌ Mǒonsê la ne ńdɔgɔ wɔ́b ńgÿo menkwɔɔn, mbɔɔ páʼ à ge gÿo pege metsèm cʉ́ʼ púɔ Ssé.
en: to redeem those under the law, so that we might receive adoption as sons.

ngiemboon: Áa nénʉ́, pi ee kwàʼ púɔ Ssé. Aliŋé áa páʼ Ssé la néŋe Zẅìge Míŋ we tsɛ̀ɛ mentʉ́m mégè, á Zẅìge gie á gÿo pege tóŋo Ssé lê Ábà. Á lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie Tá wɔɔn.
en: And because you are sons, God sent the Spirit of his Son   into our  # 4:6 Other mss read your hearts, crying, “Abba,  # 4:6 Aramaic for father Father! ”  # 4:6 Mk 14:36; Rm 8:15

ngiemboon: Púʼu, ɔ̀ te gíŋ ńgwɔ́ nkwɔɔn wɔ́. Ɔ̀ cʉ́ʼ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ Míŋ we nzyé. Páʼ ɔ̀ cʉ̌ʼ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ Míŋ we la, e Ssé ge gÿo ná shú shúm sie à la leʼe lénáa mbwó púɔ pé.
en: So you are no longer a slave   but a son,  # 4:7 Dt 14:1; Mt 5:9 and if a son, then God has made you an heir.  # 4:7 Nm 26:52–62; Rm 4:14; 8:17

ngiemboon: Pi laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ pi te ne ńzsé Ssé wɔ́, ńgwɔ́ menkwɔɔn shúm sie mé lɔgɔ ńgÿo Ssé, táʼ, e te Ssé wɔ́.
en: But in the past, since you didn’t know God,   you were enslaved to things  # 4:8 Or beings that by nature are not gods.

ngiemboon: Á piŋ ńgʉa na fʉ̀ʼɔɔn pi ne ńzsé Ssé tà mèŋ kɔʼɔ́ fó gɔɔn pɔ́ ngie Ssé ne ńzsé gẅí. Á piŋ ngǎ pi gíŋe ḿbiŋe nzèm, á tsɛ̀ɛ sɛ̌ shúm sie é té metʉ̀ gẅiin, ńké te tsɔ́ mmó gẅiin? Pi kwoŋo légíŋ ḿbiŋ nzèm ńzẅíŋ menkwɔɔn mbwó pɔ́b keen?
en: But now, since you know God,   or rather have become known by God, how can you turn back again to the weak and worthless  # 4:9 Mk 14:17; Rm 15:26 elements?  # 4:9 Col 2:8 Do you want to be enslaved to them all over again?

ngiemboon: Pi kwéʼe nzẅìŋ tsɔ́ melyɛʼɛ́ nzse, ńkwéʼe we tsɔ́ mesaŋ, ńkwéʼe we tsɔ́ mefʉ̀ʼʉ láʼ lâ we tsɔ́ mengùʼ tɛʼ.
en: You are observing special days, months, seasons, and years.

ngiemboon: M bɔ́gɔ mmó gie pi ne ńgÿo lɛ, ngwɔ́ mefàʼ mie mèŋ ka faʼa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi cʉa sẅɛ̀ɛ.
en: I am fearful for you, that perhaps my labor for you has been wasted.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn, mèŋ sẅiŋté gẅí tɛʼ ngie pi gʉa na menò lepʉ̌ ḿbí fʉ̀ʼ na mèŋ. Á gʉa mǒ, mbà n déen ńcʉ́ʼ páʼ pi la gwɔ́. Á laa fʉ̀ʼ gie n daa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi ńne shwóŋo gẅí nò Ssé, pi te gÿo nò tepòŋ na mèŋ pɛ́ʼɛ̀ wɔ́.
en: I beg you, brothers and sisters: Become as I am, for I also have become as you are. You have not wronged me;

ngiemboon: Pi kímte ngie ammó gie á la gÿo n tsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo mbwó pi, á mvɔ̀gmvfò fʉ̀ʼ gie n da tóo mbʉ̀a pi, á laa páʼ n da ne ńguɔ.
en: you know   that previously I preached the gospel to you because of a weakness of the flesh.

ngiemboon: Á laa fʉʼó, mbà guɔ cúɔ wɔ́ɔn tɛʼ, tà m bú ḿbÿɔ́g. Tá pi ké te wɔ́ɔn nyiŋe, ńké te wɔ́ɔn gwáʼ. Tà ńcʉ́ʼ púʼu, mbà pi la kúe wɔ́ɔn pɔ́ páʼ Cÿɔ́ʼ Ssé, kà pɔ́ páʼ Yěsô Keleto wɔ́ɔ la.
en: You did not despise or reject me though my physical condition was a trial for you.   On the contrary, you received me as an angel of God, as Christ Jesus himself.

ngiemboon: Lekág gẅie à laa ntʉ́m pi, à kéen ḿpfó nzɔ̌? N kuʼu légɔɔn ngie á laa péʼe ńgwaa ńgwɔ́, pi tsɔ́ʼ menÿɔ́g mí ńdɔg ńkúbe mɔ́ɔn, mbà pi la tsɔ́ʼ ńdɔg ńkúbe fʉʼó.
en: Where, then, is your blessing? For I testify to you that, if possible, you would have torn out your eyes and given them to me.

ngiemboon: Áa fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, mbà n kéen ńcʉ́ʼʉ ngàŋmbù gẅi, á nue n kě ne shwóŋo gẅí pɔ́ nò nénʉ́ keen?
en: So then, have I become your enemy because I told you the truth?

ngiemboon: Pi ne ńgyá ngie pazíʼi gẅí menò ŋwɛ́ ne ńkwoŋo gẅí tɛʼ, táʼ, nkwaŋá gẅie pɔ́ gẅiin na pi, é té wembòŋo wɔ́. Pɔ́ faʼa pɔ́ léfó nzèm mèŋ, ńkẅile gẅí, pi cʉ́ʼʉ ńkwoŋo pɔ́ wɔ́b.
en: They court you eagerly, but not for good. They want to exclude you from me, so that you would pursue them.

ngiemboon: Tá á gʉa na mèŋ, n kwoŋo gẅí, tà ngwɔ́ pi jÿó pì yɔ́ɔn ngwòŋ fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm, tà á le gwɔ́ pɔ́ ndàʼ fʉ̀ʼ gie n gee tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi wɔ́.
en: But it is always good to be pursued   in a good manner #— #and not just when I am with you.

ngiemboon: Egubé yɔ́ɔn, n gǐŋ ne ńgyá ngɔ́ʼ sẅé sẅé na pi pɔ́ páʼ manzwě gẅie à ne ńdúme ńgee ńzyé la. N ge ké gyá ngɔ́ʼ pɔ́ púʼu, tà kú fʉ̀ʼ gie pi cʉ̌ʼ kwàʼ pʉ̀a Keleto.
en: My children,   I am again suffering labor pains  # 4:19 1Co 4:15; Jms 1:18 for you until Christ is formed in you.

ngiemboon: Áa fʉ̀ʼɔɔn páʼɔɔn n ne ńtsɔ́ɔn tɛʼ légwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, tá ńzsé ntí gie ngwɔ́ n dɔg éshwóŋo gẅí nò púʼu. Á nue n ne ńkwaŋte menò mí ńcʉ́ʼʉ ḿbɔ́gɔ pɔ̌g.
en: I would like to be with you right now and change my tone of voice, because I don’t know what to do about you.

ngiemboon: Pi pie pi ne ńkwoŋo ngie lepʉ̌ sáʼa gẅí, pi shwóŋo wɔ́ɔn: Pi te ne ńjúʼu mmó gie lepʉ̌ ŋwɛ́ gɔɔn wɔ́ ka?
en: Tell me, you who want to be under the law, don’t you hear the law?

ngiemboon: Mé la ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwàʼne lepʉ̌ ŋwɛ́ ngie: Ábalaham la gẅiin gubé yépʉ́a, tàʼ gwɔ́ gẅie à la zyé na manzwě gẅie à laa nkwɔɔn, wetsɔ̌ gwɔ́ gẅie à la zyé na manzwě gẅie à la tá.
en: For it is written that Abraham   had two sons, one by a slave  # 4:22 Rm 8:15,21; Heb 2:15 and the other by a free woman.

ngiemboon: Míŋ nkwɔɔn laa gẅie pʉ̀a mesoŋ la kwoŋ kwoŋ ńzyé yé. Míŋ manzwě gẅie à la tá, á gwɔ́ gẅie mé la gwaa zyé yé, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ nò gie Ssé la kaʼ.
en: But the one by the slave was born as a result of the flesh, while the one by the free woman was born through promise.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò áa gie ngwɔ́ mé gíŋ ńjúʼu na tsɔ́ shÿó. Panzwě pɔɔn mépʉ́a lɔgɔ ńnyɛɛ kʉ̀a sépʉ́a. Ndùŋmvfò kʉ̀a gwɔ́ gie á la fó ndùm lekwɔʼɔ́ Sinayi. Ayɛ̌ kʉ̀a gÿo, mé zyé gubé, é gwɔ́ pɔ́ menkwɔɔn. Á lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ Agaa.
en: These things are being taken figuratively, for the women represent two covenants. One is from Mount Sinai   and bears children into slavery #— #this is Hagar.  # 4:24 Gn 16:1

ngiemboon: Á gíŋ ńgwɔ́ ngie lezíŋ Agaa tsẅéʼe na se Sinayi, é lekwɛ́ sie ée Alabi. Agaa lɔgɔ páʼɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tÿǒsoŋo Yelúzálèm ye fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, á gie pâ pʉ̀a pé metsèm gwɔ́ pɔ́ menkwɔɔn lepʉ̌.
en: Now Hagar represents Mount Sinai in Arabia   and corresponds to the present Jerusalem,  # 4:25 Mt 23:37; Ac 8:1 for she is in slavery with her children.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, Yelúzálèm we tÿǒ lepwó à te nkwɔɔn wɔ́, yé zɔɔ má wege.
en: But the Jerusalem above   is free, and she is our mother.

ngiemboon: Aŋwàʼne Ssé zɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie: «Néŋe né lekág, n gɔɔn né gù gẅie ɔɔ nkǐŋ!
en: For it is written,

ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn, á gʉa na pi, mbà pi ee gubé gie mé la zyé wɔ́b na ntí gie Ssé la kaʼ, ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ Ésàg la.
en: Now you too, brothers and sisters, like Isaac,   are children of promise.  # 4:28 Gn 12:7; Rm 9:8; Gl 3:29

ngiemboon: Táʼ, páʼ á laa tsɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ, múɔ gẅie mé la kwoŋ kwoŋ ńzyé ne ńkʉ́e gẅie Zẅìge Ssé zɔ̌ la gÿo tá mé zyé yé la, á gíŋ ńgwɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ púʼu.
en: But just as then the child born as a result of the flesh persecuted the one born as a result of the Spirit,   so also now.  # 4:29 Gn 21:9

ngiemboon: Aŋwàʼne Ssé zɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie kɔ́ lɛ? Á gɔɔn ngie: Jwoŋo manzwě gẅie aa nkwɔɔn pɔ́ míŋ we. Á nue míŋ nkwɔɔn te gẅiin tsɔ́ nò na tÿɔgɔ́ tá wɔb páʼ míŋ manzwě gẅie mé la tá wɔ́.
en: But what does the Scripture say? “Drive out the slave and her son, for the son of the slave will never be a coheir with the son of the free woman.”   ,# 4:30 Gn 21:10

ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn, áa mmó gie á gÿo pege té gubé manzwě gẅie aa nkwɔɔn wɔ́, pege gwɔ̌ pɔ́ gubé manzwě gẅie mé la tá.
en: Therefore, brothers and sisters, we are not children of a slave but of the free woman.
